meanings.definition: Refuse to accept or be associated with.
meanings.sent1: She decided to repudiate the offer of joining the club.
meanings.sent2: He repudiated any involvement in the crime.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to repudiate the new toy, preferring the old one instead.
meanings.sent4: His actions repudiate his earlier promises.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look seemed to repudiate any misbehavior in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Deny the truth or validity of.
meanings.sent1: The suspect continued to repudiate his involvement in the incident.
meanings.sent2: She repudiated the rumors about her family.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to repudiate the fact that he ate all the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The evidence presented in court seemed to repudiate the defendant's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's findings repudiate the previous theory about the universe.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to repudiate the false claims made by their competitor.
meanings.sent2: He repudiated the unfair treatment of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to repudiate the teacher's grading system.
meanings.sent4: Her speech aimed to repudiate the stereotypes associated with her community.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to repudiate the hate speech spread by outsiders.
